flashcards.english: Gũcũnga (doze), Gũkoma (sleep), Gũkoma na nda (sleep face down), Gũkoma na ngara/mũgongo (sleep on back), Gũkoma na mwena (sleep on side), Kũrara (spend the night), Hinga maitho ũkome (shut eyes and sleep), Koma na wega/thayũ (sleep well), Gĩa na ũtuko mwega (have a good night)
flashcards.notes: Complete sleep vocabulary. Rara nĩ gwatuka (sleep-over, darkness has fallen). Koma ũkĩre thaa igĩrĩ cia rũci-inĩ (sleep and wake at 8am). Question: Kaĩ ũkomaga ũhingũrĩte maitho? (do you sleep with eyes open?)

flashcards.english: Mũembe (mango tree), Mũcungwa (orange tree), Mũkũyũ (ficus sycamora), Mũgumo (ficus natalensis/thoningii), Mũtamaiyũ (African olive tree)
flashcards.notes: Important tree species. Mũkũyũ and Mũgumo are sacred ficus species in Kikuyu culture, traditional sites for ceremonies and sacrifices. Mũgumo is particularly sacred

flashcards.english: M: Maitũ (mother), mama (uncle), mara (intestines), moko (hands), mata (saliva). Ng: Ngaari (car), Nganga (guinea fowl), Ngobia (hat), ngoroba (floor/storey). Ng': Ng'ang'a (name/medicine man), Mũrãng'a (place), ng'aragu (hunger), ng'ethia (be idle)
flashcards.notes: Pronunciation practice. Ng' is velar nasal like 'ng' in singer (NOT finger). Example sentences: Maitũ na mama mathiire mũgũnda (Mother and uncle went to farm), Ng'ang'a ena ng'aragu (Ng'ang'a is very hungry)
Common monkey species found in Kenya. Part of wildlife vocabulary

flashcards.english: Heho (cold), Mĩaraho (midday/around and soon after midday)
flashcards.notes: Time and weather related terms. Mĩaraho refers specifically to the period around and shortly after midday
